comment.author: 57668330@N00
comment._content: 12/24/1909 - see "East Side Turns Out to Bury 'Little Tim'", 12/25/1909 New York Times. Sullivan was a popular Tammany operative and gangster.

comment.author: 20112454@N00
comment._content: The hearse in the cited newspaper account has a rounded front, while this one has a sqare front.  Might this instead be the funeral of "Big Tim" Sullivan, who died on Aug 31, 1913?

comment.author: 70251312@N00
comment._content: Yes, this is the funeral of BIG Tim, on September 15, 1913 -- not LITTLE Tim, who died in 1909. Big Tim's body was unidentified in the morgue for two weeks after its discovery on railroad tracks.

comment.author: 34904489@N07
comment._content:
jimflanny and Wystan,

Thanks for the info on this image and the others of the funeral of 'Big Tim' Sullivan.  We will update this record as well as the other related images to reflect the details.
